properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 8:30AM EST until February 11 at 2:15PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a

* Flood Warning for Small Streams in...
Central Lincoln County in central West Virginia...

* Until 215 PM EST.

* At 830 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in
the warning area. Between 0.7 and 1.3 inches of rain have fallen
so far. An additional 0.1 to 0.25 inches of rain is expected over
the warned area.   This rain coupled with an already saturated
ground has caused the Middle Fork of the Mud and the Mud Rivers to
rise.

At 8:10 AM EST, The stage reading for the Middle Fork of the Mud
River near Griffithsville was 10.62 feet.  The estimated flood stage
near Griffithsville is 11 feet.  At stages near 11 feet, Fields and
low areas along the Middle Fork Mud River both upstream and
downstream are flooded.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Sweetland, Griffithsville, Palermo and Yawkey.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
